Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: Our hero awakens from her long slumber to a brave (and very dangerous) new world.
Mission.Name: Sunrise Episode 1 - Awakening (beta v0.2)

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: Destruction of your commander unit will have fatal results for yourself. Do not let this happen under any circumstances.
TriggerLogic.Title: Protect Your Commander

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: Well, Commander. Are you prepared for this?
Still a little woozy. I think I can manage, though.

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: Fear not, Commander. I'll be with you every step of the way.

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: All must be destroyed. Resistance is futile.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
The Jumpbots, as their name suggests, are distinguished by their ability to jump. This is particularly useful for closing distances rapidly, making a quick escape, or getting over cliffs and rivers.
Note that not all units in the Jumpjet / Specialist Plant can jump.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Wind generators are a cheap source of energy, more efficient than Solar Collectors. They also receive an output bonus when placed on hills. Their principal weakness is their vulnerability to raiders.
Windgens are prone to chain explosion. Spread them out during construction. HINT: You can increase or decrease line/block spacing with the Z and X keys.
That was nasty. Who were they, and why did they attack us?
Hard to say. They seem to be transmitting a Libby code, but it's badly mangled. We can get to the bottom of this once we take them out.
Our enemies have a base in the northwest. We'll need to move quickly to contain their expansion, then punch them out. We'll be able to leave the planet at our leisure then.

TriggerLogic.Description: Destroy the enemy's Jumpjet / Specialist plant. This will cripple their unit production and give us an oppurtunity to escape.
TriggerLogic.Title: Destroy Enemy Factory

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: Your command unit has not made it through the last few hundred years in pristine condition, ma'am. Please try not to get us both killed.

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: These Pyros are quite bothersome. Got any ideas, Sophia?
Well, you've probably noticed the ineffectiveness of raiders, and their armor lets them take riots on near-equal terms. Try using something that can stun them in place.
These Jacks are tough as hell. What's a good way to deal with them?
If we had some sort of mobile, accurate skirmisher... As it is, you shall have to take your chances with the Zeus. As long as you keep your distance, the fight should turn out in your favor.
A Tick. A couple of these seeded in the path of an enemy blob can completely turn things around - just make sure to have something on hand to finish the job.

The Tick is an all-terrain crawling bomb designed to get in close and explode, stunning multiple enemies for up to sixteen seconds and leaving them vulnerable to allied forces. High HP units will require multiple Ticks in close sequence to disable.
Like its explosive cousin, the Roach, the Tick can burrow to avoid detection until enemies are close. It should not attempt to charge enemy units with accurate weapons.
Be careful when using multiple Ticks together; a Tick stunned by one of its friends cannot detonate unless killed by weapons fire.

TriggerLogic.Name: Convo Message
TriggerLogic.Message: Well, Commander. How does it feel to be alive again?
Feels like I've never been gone.
Just like old times, Ada. Just like old times.
